name: Vattakottai Fort
description: Vattakottai Fort, also known as 'Circular Fort', is a majestic fortification situated near Kanyakumari, Tamil Nadu which marks the southern tip of India. Built-in the 18th century as a fortress and barracks during the Travancore kingdom period, it served as an important sea defense base.It was constructed in the 18th century by Punachal/Elakkara Valiyaveetil Marthandan Chempakaraman Pillai for the kings of Travancore.The fort is made of granite blocks and, today, a part of the fort extends into the sea. The Indian archaeological department has declared this site a protected area, and recently completed a renovation to the fort. It has now become a popular tourist destination, due to its reinvention and preservation.
